name: Bonfire (itch) (Durhnevir)
description:
Bonfire is an atmospheric, feel good game, in which you'll only have to keep your fire going and appreciate your surroundings. Start your fire and maintain it as long as you want, play with it and let it hypnotise you.

At some point maybe will you see travelers stopping by, sharing a moment with you, playing an instrument, singing a song, reading a book, and always without a word, resume their voyage.

Bonfire started as a little programming project, but instead we decided to do something bigger. I was the Game Designer and Unity Programmer and was accompanied by three Artists: 
Nathaël Godeux, Louis Keucker, Arthur Dupeuble

We have vision for this game that is not yet achieved, and we are currently working on it on the side.

Developement Log v0.1 :

  • Most of the background props
  • Mouse controls
  • Stirring the fire with a stick (raw controls)
  • Several types of wood for the fire: 2 logs, 2 sticks, 1 twigs
  • Interaction (pick up, move, rotate) with the wood
  • Progressive destruction of wood in the fire
  • Fire shader evolving with time
  • Not yet endless, the game automatically stops after some time
